title: Fed’s Daly Is Ready to Start Debate Over Paring Central Bank Stimulus
sub_head: ‘We are talking about talking about tapering,’ Ms. Daly said Tuesday
body:
Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco leader Mary Daly said Tuesday the U.S. central bank is in the initial phase of considering how and when to pull back on its heavy levels of stimulus.
“We are talking about talking about tapering,” Ms. Daly said in a CNBC interview, in reference to an eventual slowdown in the pace of bond buying stimulus. “I want to make sure that everyone knows that it’s not about doing anything now. Right now policy is in a very good place” and patience is important for the Fed and how it conducts monetary...
